business.headline: EPFO to speed up higher pension applications, payouts likely by year-end: ReportThe EPFO has received about 1.75 million applications from pensioners who want to get a higher pension based on their actual wages, out of a total of 7.8 million pensioners.

Explained: Why Sensex, Nifty fell sharply moments before stock market closingBy market close, the BSE Sensex had dropped 411.97 points to 80,334.81, while the Nifty 50 fell 140.60 points to 24,273.80. The India VIX, often seen as the market's fear gauge, spiked over 10 per cent to cross the 21 mark—its highest since early April.

Reliance withdraws 'Operation Sindoor' trademark, says it was filed inadvertentlyOn May 7, four different applications were made to trademark the phrase 'Operation Sindoor' under Class 41 of the Nice Classification. This category includes services like films, shows, online content, education, cultural events and more.

Kamikaze 'suicide' drone maker's stock jumps after 'Operation Sindoor'. Details hereListed on the NASDAQ under the ticker ESLT, Elbit's stock rose 3.62% over two sessions, jumping from $400.00 on May 6 to $414.47 by May 8.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as panic grows over India-Pak tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex had fallen over 700 points just a few minutes before closing. However, it bounced back to end 412 points lower at 80,334.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 140.60 points to close at 24,273.80.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes 7%, trading haltedAccording to the official notification from the exchange, trading was paused after the benchmark index plunged 6.3% in a short period. The sharp fall triggered automatic circuit breakers to stop further decline.

ITR Filing 2025: What is ITR Form 3, check eliigibility, documents and deadlinesYou should file ITR-3 if you run a business or work as a self-employed professional, regardless of whether a tax audit is needed.

India-Pak tensions lift Chinese jet maker's stock by 36% in 2 daysAs of Thursday, the company's share price rose by 16.37% to reach 80.68 yuan. This was after a 17% jump on Wednesday. In total, the stock has gained 36.21% in two days and has gone up 44% in the past one month.

'Retirement age is moving from 60 to 45': An investment banker explains whyUnlike lawyers or doctors, where experience adds value, senior professionals in corporate roles like sales, marketing, operations, product, and tech, are seen as costly and sometimes out of touch, said the investment banker.

Why stock market investors shouldn't panic amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsWhile 'Operation Sindoor' led to worries about increased market volatility and losses, the main indices on Dalal Street actually managed to end in green in the previous session. Even today, the stock markets are trading in positive territory.

Pakistan's forex is slipping fast. More trouble ahead for already debt-ridden economy?A bailout by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), including a loan of $2 billion in March this year, gave Pakistan some breathing room. But the current situation could undo much of that progress.

'You can now automate strategies': Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on NSE's new algo rulesZerodha's founder and CEO, Nithin Kamath, hailed NSE's new rules to ease algo trading for retail users and explained the main update in simple terms.

Will rising Indo-Pak tensions dent foreign investment inflows to India?India's economy, which recently crossed the $4 trillion mark, has minimal direct trade with Pakistan. As a result, cross-border missile strikes carried out by India had limited immediate impact on domestic equities, currencies, or bonds.

Google cuts 200 jobs in latest round of restructuring: ReportGoogle described the changes as "small" adjustments meant to foster "greater collaboration" and improve how quickly teams can serve customers.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as market reacts to India-Pakistan tensionThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading down by 56.88 points to 80,689.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 32.25 points to 24,382.15 as of 9:30 AM.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market to go down amid India-Pakistan tension?At 8:40 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,451. This suggests that the Nifty50 index may open marginally higher or close to Wednesday's closing level of 24,414.4 as investors are expected to be cautious.
Stocks to watch on May 8: Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints, PNBStocks to watch on Thursday, May 8, include several well-known companies such as Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints and PNB.
Government issues Letter of Intent to Musk's satellite internet venture StarlinkPrior to this, the government had issued licences to Eutelsat OneWeb and Jio Satellite Communications.

ULIPs, mutual funds or stocks: What's the best for long-term wealth creation?Mutual funds, ULIPs, and stocks offer different paths to wealth. While ULIPs mix insurance with investment, mutual funds offer flexibility and professional management. Stocks offer high returns but carry more risk and demand expertise.

New NPS rules: How to close your account after renouncing Indian citizenshipAny Indian citizen aged between 18 and 70 years can open an NPS account. Additionally, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs) can also open an NPS account, as long as they meet the necessary requirements set by the PFRDA.

Sensex ends 106 points higher, Nifty above 24,400; Tata Motors jumps 5%The BSE Sensex was up 105.71 points higher to 80,746.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 34.80 points to settle at 24,414.40. Most of the broader market indices also recovered after falling in early trade.

HDFC Bank trims these lending rates from May 7. Will your EMIs go down?This move comes shortly after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate by 25 bps in April, taking the total cut to 50 bps since February 2025.

Operation Sindoor: Should Dalal Street investors worry about what's next?There was no sell-off, no bloodbath, just a bit of volatility. For many retail investors, the calm felt unusual — shouldn't a military flare-up between nuclear neighbours spook the markets? But past data suggests otherwise.

Taking a personal loan for a wedding? Here are 6 key tips to keep in mindWeddings can tempt us to go overboard, but it's best to plan a realistic budget. See where you can cut costs or use your savings first. Borrow just the amount you really need, don't take a bigger loan just because you're eligible for it.

Filing ITR? Here's how to choose the right tax regimeWhile the new regime offers reduced tax slabs, it doesn't let you claim the usual deductions available under the old regime. It's lower rates, but with fewer tax-saving options.

Whisky, cars, and jobs: Inside India's game-changing UK free trade pactThe India-UK trade deal holds significance in a world drifting back toward trade barriers and tariff wars. With Trump-era protectionism rearing its head again, the timing of this pact couldn't be better.
PwC to cut 1,500 jobs in the US: ReportLast year, PwC was in the news for possibly cutting half of its auditing staff in China's financial services sector.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes nearly 6% after 'Operation Sindoor'The Karachi Stock Exchange 100 index (KSE-100) plunged 6,272 points in early trade, sliding to 107,296.64 — a sharp drop from Tuesday's close of 113,568.51.

Explained: Why Info Edge shares look like they've crashed 80% todayInfo Edge shares traded ex-split today after the company carried out a 1:5 stock split, its first since its 2006 listing. As a result, each share with a face value of Rs 10 has been subdivided into five shares of Rs 2 each.

Explained: Why foreign portfolio investors are buying Indian financial stocksData from the National Securities Depository shows FPIs bought Rs 18,409 crore ($2.18 billion) worth of shares in the sector last month, propelling the Nifty Financial Services index to a 4.1% gain.

Scotch whisky prices set to drop after India-UK trade deal. Details hereThe reduction is expected to bring premium and mid-range Scotch whiskies within reach of a larger section of Indian consumers. A bottle that typically costs Rs 5,000 could soon be priced between Rs 3,500 and Rs 4,000 following the initial tariff cut.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as markets stay calm after 'Operation Sindoor'The Sensex fell sharply in pre-opening, but recovered as soon as the markets opened at 9:15 am. At around 9:30 am, Sensex was trading 143.08 points higher at 80,784.15, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 56.60 points to trade at 24,432.

Paytm nears full profitability; revenue grows to Rs 1,911 crorePaytm's revenue increased by 5% quarter-on-quarter, reaching Rs 1,911 crore, reflecting the company's steady performance and continued momentum in its core businesses.

Need a personal loan? Unlock Rs 5 lakh instantly using just your PAN cardTo apply online, you simply visit the bank or lender's website and fill out the application form. You'll need to provide your name, date of birth, mobile number, and PAN number.

Sensex ends 156 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Adani Enterprises falls 4%The BSE Sensex ended 155.77 points lower at 80,641.07, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to settle at 24,379.60. Most of the broader market indices also declined during the trading session due to high selling pressure.

Yes Bank denies reports of stake sale to Japan's SMBC, calls it 'speculative'The private sector lender clarified that while it regularly explores business opportunities, there is nothing material to disclose under current regulatory norms.

Saying yes to a joint loan? Here's how it can affect your credit scoreEvery time an EMI is paid on time, it reflects positively on both borrowers' credit profiles. Over time, this builds your credit score. If you were added as a co-applicant to help someone get a loan because your own score was low, this is your chance to improve it.

ITR filing 2025: 5 common mistakes you must avoid while filing your tax returnsUsing the wrong ITR form can delay your tax processing or, worse, your return may get rejected. Also, filing your ITR is not the final step, you must also verify it.

Is the worst over for global economy as Trump eases stance on tariffs?Even as Trump suggests deals are near with countries like India, Japan, and South Korea, and China reviews a fresh proposal from Washington, the global economy isn't breathing easy yet.

entertainment.headline: ACM Awards 2025: How to stream the show live on Amazon Prime Video and TwitchThe ACM Awards 2025, hosted by Reba McEntire, will feature star-studded performances, including Rascal Flatts with Backstreet Boys and Chris Stapleton. Stream it live for free on Amazon Prime Video and Twitch.

Jennifer Aniston stalker ordered to undergo mental evaluation after gate crashA man accused of stalking Jennifer Aniston and ramming his car into her Bel Air gate has been ordered to undergo a mental evaluation after years of alleged harassment and felony charges.

From Austin to Stockholm: Full schedule for 2025 Ultrasound world tourPop star Lorde returns with her album Virgin on June 27, 2025, followed by the Ultrasound Tour across North America, the UK, and Europe. Tickets go on sale May 16.

Gram Chikitsalay review: Amol Parashar adds life to this tale of healing and hopeReleased-Fri May 09, 2025Gram Chikitsalay series review: The TVF series set in rural Jharkhand, features a young doctor's earnest struggle to win the trust of villagers who prefer a local quack. With sincere performances and authentic storytelling, the show beautifully captures the challenges and hope. It also highlights the real need for a change in the neglected healthcare sector.

Sonu Nigam, Arijit Singh to recreate Sandese Aate Hai song  for Border 2: ReportSonu Nigam and Arijit Singh will recreate the patriotic song 'Sandese Aate Hai' for 'Border 2.' T-Series has acquired the rights of the iconic song for Rs 10 crore, making it the most expensive Bollywood song remake to date.

Ameesha Patel: Pay disparity is justified, but there shouldn't be a wide gapAmeesha Patel candidly addresses key issues in Bollywood, including pay disparity, ageism, and rising film budgets, emphasising the need for balance and fairness.

Virat Kohli's brother slams Rahul Vaidya's comments: What a loserCricketer Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas Kohli, has reacted to Rahul Vaidya's comments where he called him a 'joker'. Kannada director on replacing Sonu Nigam's songs: He must pay a priceKannada director, who replaced two Sonu Nigam songs in his upcoming film 'Kuladalli Keelyavudo' following the singer's concert controversy, said that his apology is not enough.

1 film every 3 years: Why are young Telugu directors delaying film productions?Once celebrated for rapid, inventive filmmaking, new directors of the Telugu cinema now take two-three years between projects. Rising budgets, cautious OTT deals and a shrinking writing pool have forced even proven talents into lengthy pauses.

Was Nawazuddin Siddiqui Ranveer Singh's acting coach? Costao actor revealsNawazuddin Siddiqui revealed he trained Ranveer Singh ahead of his debut in Band Baaja Baaraat, during his days as an acting workshop mentor. While he guided many aspiring actors, Siddiqui credited Ranveer's success to his own talent.

Singer Pawandeep Rajan out of ICU, friend shares pic from hospitalIndian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan recently met with a serious car accident near Moradabad, has been shifted from the ICU to a private room. His friend Govind Digari shared the update.

Rishab Shetty begins last schedule of Kantara 2 after death of junior artisteRishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1', a prequel to the 2022 blockbuster film, is among the most highly-anticipated Indian films of the year. Despite several setbacks during production, the makers have now entered the final schedule of shoots for the film.

Munawar Faruqui, Shehnaaz Gill, and celebs take acting class from Saurabh SachdevaShehnaaz Gill, Karan Veer Mehra, Munawar Faruqui, Kubbra Sait, and others participated in a workshop conducted by veteran actor Saurabh Sachdeva. Take a look at the pictures here.

Reborn Rich Season 2 production confirmed without Song Joong-kiThe popular 2022 K-drama 'Reborn Rich' has been officially renewed for its eagerly-awaited second season, promising a gripping tale of ambition, love, and power within a global corporation. Fans can look forward to a large-scale production that aims to connect emotionally with international audiences.

Piku and its healing powers: How a film becomes so much more...'Piku', starring Amitabh Bachchan, Deepika Padukone, and the late legendary actor, Irrfan, completes 10 years today. While on the surface, it remains a film about a father-daughter relationship and the art of subtle romance, it is so much more than that. It, in fact, is life itself.

Filmmakers rush to secure Operation Sindoor title, 15 studios seek registrationFollowing India's precision strikes on terror camps, numerous Bollywood studios are rushing to register the title 'Operation Sindoor' for potential war films.

Saif Ali Khan says Taimur has stage fear, doesn't want to perform publiclyTaimur Ali Khan, son of actors Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan, is not interested in acting, said his father. Saif shared that his son feels shy on stage and doesn't like performing in front of people.

general news.headline: India repels Pak's Hamas-style missile, drone attack, shoots down 3 jetsJammu, along with parts of Rajasthan and Punjab, was targeted by drone and missile attacks by Pakistan, following India's strike on Pakistani terror camps.

JD Vance says US will not intervene in India-Pak dispute: 'None of our business'US Vice President JD Vance said America won't intervene in the India-Pakistan conflict, calling it "none of our business." He urged de-escalation through diplomacy, while President Trump said he hopes the hostilities end quickly and offered help.

US Cardinal Robert Prevost elected new Pope, has taken the name Pope Leo XIVPope Leo, appeared on the central balcony of St. Peter's Basilica around 70 minutes after white smoke billowed from a chimney atop the Sistine Chapel signifying the 133 cardinal electors had chosen a new leader for the 1.4 billion-member Catholic Church.

X blocks over 8,000 accounts in India, says 'following government orders'X has blocked over 8,000 accounts in India following government orders, citing threats of fines and jail. The platform criticizes the move as censorship and urges legal action by users.

Pak F-16 down, drone attack foiled: Indian Akash, MRSAM in actionThe integrated grid, activated across 1,800 km of airspace, intercepted swarms of drones and missiles targeting 15 military installations, including bases in Jammu, Srinagar, Pathankot, and Bhuj.

Justice Yashwant Varma refuses to resign, impeachment process to start soon: SourcesJustice Yashwant Varma has refused to resign from the Delhi High Court despite a Supreme Court-appointed panel confirming a large cash recovery from his residence. The process to impeach him is set to start soon.

India destroys China-made missile shield in Lahore. What are Pak's HQ-9, HQ-16?India countered an aerial attack by Pakistan on the night of May 7 and hit its air defence system. India's strike destroyed the HQ-9P and HQ-16 missile defence systems, built by China and customised for Pakistan. China uses the HQ-9 system, with a longer range of surface-to-air missiles, for its defence.

Jasprit Bumrah should lead India's Test side on England tour: Anil KumbleFormer India skipper Anil Kumble said he would like to see pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah lead India in their five-match Test tour of England in June-July.

BCCI punishes Varun Chakravarthy for IPL code of conduct breach vs CSKKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) spinner Varun Chakravarthy was fined 25 percent of his match fee and handed one demerit point for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at Eden Gardens.

Rohit Sharma slams Indian commentary standards, says criticism is agenda-drivenRohit Sharma accused Indian commentators of focusing on a single star player and repeatedly discussing his personal life, rather than appreciating and analysing the game itself.

DC in must-win territory against PBKS in Dharamsala as playoff race heats upPBKS vs DC, IPL 2025 Preview: Delhi Capitals will be desperate to halt their downward slide and keep their playoff hopes alive when they face an in-form Punjab Kings in a high-stakes IPL 2025 clash in Dharamsala on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
